childMarkdownRemark.html:
Ingredients:

  • 8 oz (225g) pancit canton noodles
  • 1/2 lb (225g) chicken breast, sliced into thin strips
  • 1/2 lb (225g) pork, sliced into thin strips
  • 1/2 lb (225g) shrimp, peeled and deveined
  • 2 tablespoons cooking oil
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 medium-sized onion, sliced
  • 1 carrot, julienned
  • 1 small cabbage, shredded
  • 1 cup snow peas
  • 1 cup chicken broth
  • 3 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 2 tablespoons oyster sauce
  • Fish sauce (patis), to taste
  • Ground black pepper, to taste
  • Calamansi or lemon wedges (for serving)

Instructions:

  1. Soak the pancit canton noodles in warm water for about 10 minutes or according to the package instructions until they soften. Drain and set aside.

  2. In a large wok or skillet, heat the cooking oil over medium-high heat. Add the minced garlic and sliced onion. Saut√© until the onion becomes translucent and the garlic is lightly browned.

  3. Add the chicken breast and pork slices to the wok. Stir-fry until the meat is cooked through and no longer pink.

  4. Add the shrimp to the wok and continue stir-frying for another 2-3 minutes until the shrimp turns pink and opaque.

  5. Add the julienned carrots, shredded cabbage, and snow peas to the wok. Stir-fry for about 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are slightly tender.

  6. In a small bowl, whisk together the chicken broth, soy sauce, and oyster sauce. Pour the sauce mixture into the wok with the meat and vegetables.

  7. Add the drained pancit canton noodles to the wok and toss them with the meat, vegetables, and sauce. Stir-fry for about 5-6 minutes, or until the noodles are fully coated with the sauce and heated through.

  8. Season the pancit canton with fish sauce (patis) and ground black pepper to taste. Adjust the seasoning according to your preference.

  9. Continue to stir-fry the pancit canton for another 1-2 minutes until everything is well combined and the flavors have melded together.

  10. Remove the pancit canton from the heat and transfer it to a serving platter.

  11. Serve the pancit canton hot, garnished with calamansi or lemon wedges on the side. Squeeze the calamansi or lemon juice over the pancit before eating for added tanginess.

Pancit Canton is a delicious and hearty Filipino dish that is perfect for gatherings or as a satisfying meal. Enjoy the combination of flavors and textures in this classic noodle dish!
